00001 <?php
00002 /** @file
00003  * This extension provides support for common HTML list operations.
00004  */
00005 
00006 /**
00007  * Provide list operations for QueryPath.
00008  *
00009  * The QPList class is an extension to QueryPath. It provides HTML list generators
00010  * that take lists and convert them into bulleted lists inside of QueryPath.
00011  *
00012  * @deprecated This will be removed from a subsequent version of QueryPath. It will
00013  *  be released as a stand-alone extension.
00014  * @ingroup querypath_extensions
00015  */ 
00016 class QPList implements QueryPathExtension {
00017   const UL = 'ul';
00018   const OL = 'ol';
00019   const DL = 'dl';
00020   
00021   protected $qp = NULL;
00022   public function __construct(QueryPath $qp) {
00023     $this->qp = $qp;
00024   }
00025   
00026   public function appendTable($items, $options = array()) {
00027     $opts = $options + array(
00028       'table class' => 'qptable',
00029     );
00030     $base = '<?xml version="1.0"?>
00031     <table>
00032     <tbody>
00033       <tr></tr>
00034     </tbody>
00035     </table>';
00036     
00037     $qp = qp($base, 'table')->addClass($opts['table class'])->find('tr');
00038     if ($items instanceof TableAble) {
00039       $headers = $items->getHeaders();
00040       $rows = $items->getRows();
00041     }
00042     elseif ($items instanceof Traversable) {
00043       $headers = array();
00044       $rows = $items;
00045     }
00046     else {
00047       $headers = $items['headers'];
00048       $rows = $items['rows'];
00049     }
00050     
00051     // Add Headers:
00052     foreach ($headers as $header) {
00053       $qp->append('<th>' . $header . '</th>');
00054     }
00055     $qp->top()->find('tr:last');
00056     
00057     // Add rows and cells.
00058     foreach ($rows as $row) {
00059       $qp->after('<tr/>')->next();
00060       foreach($row as $cell) $qp->append('<td>' . $cell . '</td>');
00061     }
00062     
00063     $this->qp->append($qp->top());
00064     
00065     return $this->qp;
00066   }
00067   
00068   /**
00069    * Append a list of items into an HTML DOM using one of the HTML list structures.
00070    * This takes a one-dimensional array and converts it into an HTML UL or OL list,
00071    * <b>or</b> it can take an associative array and convert that into a DL list.
00072    *
00073    * In addition to arrays, this works with any Traversable or Iterator object.
00074    *
00075    * OL/UL arrays can be nested.
00076    *
00077    * @param mixed $items
00078    *   An indexed array for UL and OL, or an associative array for DL. Iterator and
00079    *  Traversable objects can also be used.
00080    * @param string $type
00081    *  One of ul, ol, or dl. Predefined constants are available for use.
00082    * @param array $options
00083    *  An associative array of configuration options. The supported options are:
00084    *  - 'list class': The class that will be assigned to a list.
00085    */
00086   public function appendList($items, $type = self::UL, $options = array()) {
00087     $opts = $options + array(
00088       'list class' => 'qplist',
00089     );
00090     if ($type == self::DL) {
00091       $q = qp('<?xml version="1.0"?><dl></dl>', 'dl')->addClass($opts['list class']);
00092       foreach ($items as $dt => $dd) {
00093         $q->append('<dt>' . $dt . '</dt><dd>' . $dd . '</dd>');
00094       }
00095       $q->appendTo($this->qp);
00096     }
00097     else {
00098       $q = $this->listImpl($items, $type, $opts);
00099       $this->qp->append($q->find(':root'));
00100     }
00101     
00102     return $this->qp;
00103   }
00104   
00105   /**
00106    * Internal recursive list generator for appendList.
00107    */
00108   protected function listImpl($items, $type, $opts, $q = NULL) {
00109     $ele = '<' . $type . '/>';
00110     if (!isset($q))
00111       $q = qp()->append($ele)->addClass($opts['list class']);
00112           
00113     foreach ($items as $li) {
00114       if ($li instanceof QueryPath) {
00115         $q = $this->listImpl($li->get(), $type, $opts, $q);
00116       }
00117       elseif (is_array($li) || $li instanceof Traversable) {
00118         $q->append('<li><ul/></li>')->find('li:last > ul');
00119         $q = $this->listImpl($li, $type, $opts, $q);
00120         $q->parent();
00121       }
00122       else {
00123         $q->append('<li>' . $li . '</li>');
00124       }
00125     }
00126     return $q;
00127   }
00128   
00129   /**
00130    * Unused.
00131    */
00132   protected function isAssoc($array) {
00133     // A clever method from comment on is_array() doc page:
00134     return count(array_diff_key($array, range(0, count($array) - 1))) != 0; 
00135   }
00136 }
00137 QueryPathExtensionRegistry::extend('QPList');
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * A TableAble object represents tabular data and can be converted to a table.
00141  *
00142  * The {@link QPList} extension to {@link QueryPath} provides a method for
00143  * appending a table to a DOM ({@link QPList::appendTable()}).
00144  *
00145  * Implementing classes should provide methods for getting headers, rows
00146  * of data, and the number of rows in the table ({@link TableAble::size()}).
00147  * Implementors may also choose to make classes Iterable or Traversable over
00148  * the rows of the table.
00149  *
00150  * Two very basic implementations of TableAble are provided in this package:
00151  *  - {@link QPTableData} provides a generic implementation.
00152  *  - {@link QPTableTextData} provides a generic implementation that also escapes
00153  *    all data.
00154  */
00155 interface TableAble {
00156   public function getHeaders();
00157   public function getRows();
00158   public function size();
00159 }
00160 
00161 /**
00162  * Format data to be inserted into a simple HTML table.
00163  *
00164  * Data in the headers or rows may contain markup. If you want to 
00165  * disallow markup, use a {@see QPTableTextData} object instead.
00166  */
00167 class QPTableData implements TableAble, IteratorAggregate {
00168   
00169   protected $headers;
00170   protected $rows;
00171   protected $caption;
00172   protected $p = -1;
00173   
00174   public function setHeaders($array) {$this->headers = $array; return $this;}
00175   public function getHeaders() {return $this->headers; }
00176   public function setRows($array) {$this->rows = $array; return $this;}
00177   public function getRows() {return $this->rows;}
00178   public function size() {return count($this->rows);}
00179   public function getIterator() {
00180     return new ArrayIterator($rows);
00181   }
00182 }
00183 
00184 /**
00185  * Provides a table where all of the headers and data are treated as text data.
00186  * 
00187  * This provents marked-up data from being inserted into the DOM as elements. 
00188  * Instead, the text is escaped using {@see htmlentities()}.
00189  *
00190  * @see QPTableData
00191  */
00192 class QPTableTextData extends QPTableData {
00193   public function setHeaders($array) {
00194     $headers = array();
00195     foreach ($array as $header) {
00196       $headers[] = htmlentities($header);
00197     }
00198     parent::setHeaders($headers);
00199     return $this;
00200   }
00201   public function setRows($array) {
00202     $count = count($array);
00203     for ($i = 0; $i < $count; ++$i) {
00204       $cols = array();
00205       foreach ($data[$i] as $datum) {
00206         $cols[] = htmlentities($datum);
00207       }
00208       $data[$i] = $cols;
00209     }
00210     parent::setRows($array);
00211     return $this;
00212   }
00213 }
